opendial.bn

Class BNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.BNetwork
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DialogueState

    public class BNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a Bayesian Network augmented with value and action nodes. The network is simply defined as a set of nodes connected with each other.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-01-30 22:55:33 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • addNode

        public void addNode(BNode node)
        Adds a new node to the network. Note: if the node already exists, it is better to use the "replaceNode" method, to avoid warning messages.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add

        Add a collection of new nodes to the network
        Parameters:
        newNodes - the collection of nodes to add

      • addNetwork

        public void addNetwork(BNetwork network)
                throws DialException
        Adds all the nodes in the network provided as argument to the current network
        Parameters:
        network - the network to include
        Throws:
        DialException - if the inclusion fails

                 throws DialException

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the value for the node, if it exists

                    java.lang.String newNodeId)
        Modifies the node identifier in the Bayesian Network
        Parameters:
        oldNodeId - the old node identifier
        newNodeId - the new node identifier

      • reset

        public void reset(BNetwork network)
        Resets the Bayesian network to only contain the nodes contained in the argument. Everything else is erased.
        Parameters:
        network - the network that contains the nodes to include after the reset.

      • hasNode

        public boolean hasNode(java.lang.String nodeId)
        Returns true if the network contains a node with the given identifier
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the node identifier
        Returns:
        true if the node exists in the network, false otherwise

      • getNode

        public BNode getNode(java.lang.String nodeId)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the node, if it exists, or null otherwise.

        Returns:
        true if all the chance nodes is found, false otherwise

      • getNodeIds

      • getSortedNodes

        public java.util.List<BNode> getSortedNodes()
        Returns an ordered list of nodes, where the ordering is defined in the compareTo method implemented in BNode. The ordering will place end nodes (i.e. nodes with no outward edges) at the beginning of the list, and start nodes (nodes with no inward edges) at the end of the list.

        This ordering is used in particular for various inference algorithms relying on a topological ordering of the nodes (e.g. variable elimination).

        Returns:
        the ordered list of nodes

      • getCliques

        public java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getCliques()
        Returns the set of maximal cliques that compose this network. The cliques are collections of nodes such that each node in the clique is connect to all the other nodes in the clique but to no nodes outside the clique.
        Returns:
        the collection of cliques for the network.

      • createCliques

        public java.util.List<BNetwork> createCliques()
                                       throws DialException
        Creates subnetworks corresponding to the cliques of the network
        Returns:
        the subnetworks corresponding to the cliques.
        Throws:
        DialException

      • getUniqueId

        public java.lang.String getUniqueId(java.lang.String base)
        Creates a unique identifier that is guaranteed not to exist in the current network.
        Parameters:
        base - the base of the identifier
        Returns:
        the unique identifier
